DOC.brief_summary: Objective : To evaluate real acupuncture , compare sham acupuncture , improve persistent sleep difficulty veteran mild traumatic brain injury ( mTBI ) Design : Randomized , blind , sham-controlled clinical trial Setting : Outpatient clinic major VA medical center Southeast USA Participants : Sixty veteran age 24-55 ( mean 40 ) history mTBI least 3-month beyond , suffer sleep difficulty refractory regular care sleep education , indicate global Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index ( PSQI ) score 14.25 + 3.23 pre-intervention ( baseline ) . They randomize 2 group , real acupuncture versus sham acupuncture , stratify Post-traumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) diagnose PTSD CheckList - Military Version ( PCL-M ) . Intervention : Real sham acupuncture standardize individualized acupoints selection . All subject inform treatment , effective , may improve symptom pain , anxiety depression sleep ; real acupuncture may effective individual , sham acupuncture may well effective mind-body interaction . Outcome Measures : Primary outcome measure global PSQI score change intervention compare baseline . Secondary outcome measure wrist-actigraphy sleep latency , sleep efficiency , wake sleep onset ( WASO ) , sleep duration . PTSD analyze co-variant .
